page.title: 01SHERSTON,A COTSWOLD VILLAGE
page.content: On the Wiltshire Gloucestershire borders, the area is farm land on Southern fringe of the Cotswolds, and designated as an{Area of Outstanding {Natural Beauty. }It is traversed by B 4040 the old Bristol road, much quieter now since construction of M 4 took heavy traffic away. The northern half of{Sherston, including Manor Close, a new housing estate, the hamlets of Pinkney in the south and Willesley in the north comprise the only residential areas. Dotted with{farms,}land use is divided between arable and grazing for dairy herds or store cattle. Older houses are built of natural stone with stone tiled roofs, drystone walls are feature of landscape, which has lost many trees from Dutch Elm disease in recent years.
